alert.note: Alert for Wells (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS NorthernIndiana (Northern Indiana and Northeastern Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 27 at 8:43PM EST until December 31 at 11:00AM EST by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana... Wabash River near Linn Grove affecting Adams and Wells Counties. Wabash River near Bluffton IN affecting Wells County. .Rises on area rivers occurred as a result of recent rainfall. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY EVENING THROUGH FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wabash River near Bluffton IN. * WHEN...From Tuesday evening to late Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, Water reaching the bottom of the bridge at East River Road and 450 East. River Road and a few county roads are closed by high water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 PM EST Monday the stage was 8.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tomorrow evening to a crest of 10.8 feet early Wednesday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage late Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Never drive vehicles through flooded areas. The water may be too deep to allow safe passage. Never allow children to play in or near flood waters. Stay tuned to NOAA Weather Radio or local media for further statements and updated forecasts. Detailed river forecasts and additional information can be found at www.weather.gov/iwx under Rivers and Lakes. This statement will be updated within the next 12 to 24 hours.
